title: FDA Soap Regulations and TikTok Selling - What You Need to Know
author: Soapmaking Forum Community
overview: Community clarification on FDA jurisdiction over soap, TikTok selling requirements, MOCRA exemptions, and avoiding scam 'exemption services'

key_revelation.fda_and_soap: FDA does NOT regulate true soap
key_revelation.jurisdiction: FDA has no jurisdiction over true soap
key_revelation.wrong_agency: Asking FDA for soap exemption is asking wrong agency
key_revelation.confusion_source: TikTok and social media spreading misinformation

true_soap.definition: Soap with no claims and no obviously cosmetic ingredients
true_soap.tiktok_note: Doesn't even appear in TikTok's product search list

cosmetic_soap.definition: Soap with cosmetic claims or cosmetic ingredients

tiktok_requirements.what_they_want: FDA registration number for cosmetics sellers
tiktok_requirements.problem: Small businesses exempt from registration but TikTok doesn't understand this
tiktok_requirements.true_soap_solution: True soap is NOT a cosmetic - no registration needed
tiktok_requirements.cosmetic_solution: Write your own MOCRA exemption letter

mocra_small_business_exemption.what_you_need: Letter YOU write attesting to meeting exemption criteria
mocra_small_business_exemption.disclosure: Must disclose business income over MOCRA period
mocra_small_business_exemption.warning: Do NOT pay vulture companies to write it for you

fda_approved.example: No such thing as 'FDA approved skin whitening soap'

need_letter_from_fda.myth: Need letter of exemption FROM the FDA
need_letter_from_fda.reality: You write the exemption letter yourself
need_letter_from_fda.attesting_to: That you meet MOCRA small biz exemption criteria

all_soap_needs_registration.myth: All soap sellers need FDA registration
all_soap_needs_registration.reality: True soap isn't regulated by FDA at all

scam_warnings.fake_fda_sites: Many scam sites with 'fda' in URL pretending to be official
scam_warnings.exemption_services: Companies charging to write exemption letters
scam_warnings.reality: Exemption letter is free - you write it yourself
scam_warnings.advice: Be very careful when searching for TikTok cosmetics selling help

selling_requirements_us.state_business_rules: Conform to your state's business regulations
selling_requirements_us.sales_tax: Collect applicable sales tax if state requires
selling_requirements_us.exporting: Must conform to destination country rules

community_wisdom.experience_first: Gain more experience before selling anywhere
community_wisdom.learn_craft: More time learning the craft before selling is beneficial
community_wisdom.platform_specific: Each platform has its own quirks and requirements
community_wisdom.do_homework: Research platform requirements before selling there

quiz_questions.q: Does the FDA regulate true soap?
quiz_questions.a: No - FDA has no jurisdiction over true soap
quiz_questions.explanation: True soap (no claims, no cosmetic ingredients) is not FDA regulated

quiz_questions.q: What is the difference between true soap and cosmetic soap?
quiz_questions.a: True soap has no claims or cosmetic ingredients; cosmetic soap makes claims or has cosmetic ingredients
quiz_questions.explanation: Only cosmetic soap falls under FDA cosmetics regulations

quiz_questions.q: Do you need to pay a company to get an FDA exemption letter?
quiz_questions.a: No - you write the MOCRA exemption letter yourself for free
quiz_questions.explanation: Companies charging for this are 'vultures' - it's a scam

quiz_questions.a: No - FDA does NOT approve products at all
quiz_questions.explanation: There is no such thing as 'FDA approved soap'

quiz_questions.q: What do you need to sell true soap in the US?
quiz_questions.a: Conform to state business regulations and collect sales tax if required
quiz_questions.explanation: No FDA involvement needed for true soap
